name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump is restarting his daily televised coronavirus briefings today. In April, Peter Nicholas predicted that as the election approaches, Trump may be more and more tempted to use the presidential spotlight for his own purposes: https://t.co/C1719avjny

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For some current and former Republicans—skeptical of socialism but disgusted by Trump’s pitiless narcissism—a message of bipartisan, ideologically flexible compassion has deep appeal," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/EGJ05Xnvni

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Trump’s Show of Force in American Cities, by @mimbsy https://t.co/ek11LowW3X

name: TheAtlantic
text: Voice acting has long been under scrutiny about race and representation. But the recent wave of white actors departing from roles that depict characters of color has delivered a shock to the industry, @shirklesxp reports. https://t.co/3ABcBkGn6T

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the family of one murder victim, restorative justice was a balm that led to forgiveness. For another, it went almost unbelievably wrong. @elibhager reports on the meaning of restorative justice: https://t.co/g7TIaVaV1g

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sure, the creators of anti-racist reading lists mean well. But literature and dialogue cannot supplant restorative social policies and organizational change, @saigrundy writes: https://t.co/WN2faCUEYa

name: TheAtlantic
text: On an episode of the podcast Social Distance, @jameshamblin talks about what he learned about the concept of cleanliness in writing his new book. https://t.co/B9hW0RDF54
